ADDENDUM TO THE ORIGINAL LICENSE (effective November 7, 2014)
A new residential building was constructed on the premises. It is located just south
of Myriam House and named DeRoy House. The certificate of occupancy was
issued on 10/20/14. The final fire inspection was completed on 9/19/14.
This consultant completed a walk-through inspection of the building 11/6/14. A
program statement was provided. The population served will be female minors age
12 – 17 who have been deemed victims of human trafficking. Vista Maria intends to
contract with DHS for these youth.
The building has four pods with four private bedrooms on each pod for a total
capacity of sixteen. It will be considered an “open” treatment setting and staffed the
same as the current open residential program at Myriam House. The capacity for
Vista Maria Open Residential has been increased from 20 to 36 residents, housed in
Myriam and DeRoy.
II. Methodology –
Certificate of Occupancy – Issued
Program Statement – Received and reviewed
Qualified Staffing - Secured
Final Fire Inspection - Completed and Compliance
BCAL On-site Inspection - Completed
III. Recommendation
I recommend the terms of this license be changed to reflect an increase in capacity
from 20 to 36 beds for the purpose of serving the current residential treatments
needs of minor females determined to be victims of human trafficking.
December 22, 2014
